 To run the pre-commit checks locally, you can follow below steps: 1. Ensure that default python is python3. In sonic-mgmt docker container, default python is python2. You can run the check by activating the python3 virtual environment in sonic-mgmt docker container or outside of sonic-mgmt docker container. 2. Ensure that the `pre-commit` package is installed: ``` sudo pip install pre-commit ``` 3. Go to repository root folder 4. Install the pre-commit hooks: ``` pre-commit install ``` 5. Use pre-commit to check staged file: ``` pre-commit ``` 6. Alternatively, you can check committed files using: ``` pre-commit run --from-ref --to-ref ```

Regardless, this change can and should go into sonic-mgmt's 202205 branch before sonic-net/sonic-buildimage#13660 gets cherry-picked to 202205.

Hi @theasianpianist 
I've tried to run test - it work on my side, but it require some modification on my environment.
I'm using sonic-mgmt docker, from which I'm running test, but I see that in latest sonic-mgmt docker we have 3 years old PTF library for default python2.7. 
When I run test using python2.7 - test fail(can't match VXLAN packet), due to old PTF library which does not have fix: https://github.com/p4lang/ptf/commit/7494366607e2e4c171439df3585eba3c9769fad8
If I add this fix to PTF - test can pass using python2.7.

@theasianpianist from which environment did you run this test? How it's possible(in case if we both use sonic-mgmt docker) that on your side test pass with python2.7 and on my side it fail, due to old PTF?

When I run test using python3 - test case pass after some modification(posted comments in code). 

I suggest to make test running using python2.7 or python3 - with my comments modification - it can run on both versions of python.
